title: Student Management System
description: Created system design and architecture for a student management platform, focusing on implementing various design patterns in Java to ensure scalability and maintainability. Developed and optimized the application with Java and GraalVM, enhancing performance and integration.
overview: A comprehensive student management platform designed with scalability and maintainability in mind. Built using Java with GraalVM optimization for enhanced performance and seamless integration capabilities.
keyFeatures: Modular architecture using multiple design patterns (Factory, Observer, Strategy)
Student enrollment and course management system
Grade tracking and academic progress monitoring
Administrative dashboard for staff and faculty
technicalHighlights: GraalVM integration for improved startup time and memory efficiency
Implementation of Factory pattern for object creation
Repository pattern for data access layer
challenges: Implementing complex design patterns while maintaining code readability
Creating a scalable architecture for future feature additions

title: Store Inventory Management System
description: Designed a SQL-based database for a retail store, including tables, relationships, and queries to manage inventory. Implemented a Java application to connect to the SQL database, providing a user-friendly interface for store management to interact with the database, perform transactions, and generate reports.
overview: A full-stack inventory management solution combining robust SQL database design with an intuitive Java application interface. Designed to streamline retail operations and provide comprehensive reporting capabilities.
keyFeatures: Comprehensive inventory tracking with real-time updates
Sales transaction processing and receipt generation
Automated low-stock alerts and reorder notifications
technicalHighlights: Normalized SQL database design with optimized indexing
JDBC connection pooling for improved performance
Swing GUI with custom components and layouts
Data validation and error handling mechanisms
challenges: Designing efficient database schema for complex inventory relationships
Implementing concurrent access control for multiple users
Creating intuitive user interface for non-technical staff

title: Local Grocery Store App
description: Modern React application for inventory management with dynamic routing and responsive design. Features include product catalog, inventory tracking, and interactive user interface built with contemporary web technologies.
overview: A modern, responsive React application designed for local grocery store inventory management. Features contemporary web technologies and an intuitive user experience for efficient store operations.
keyFeatures: Dynamic product catalog with search and filtering capabilities
Real-time inventory tracking and stock level monitoring
Responsive design optimized for tablets and mobile devices
Customer-facing product browser with pricing information
technicalHighlights: React Router implementation for seamless navigation
Tailwind CSS for utility-first responsive design
State management using React hooks and context
Modern JavaScript ES6+ features and best practices
challenges: Creating responsive design that works across all device sizes
Implementing efficient state management for complex data flows
Optimizing performance for real-time inventory updates
